content.description: Follow bolts with some difficulty up a bulging arete on a pillar. Land on a ledge, then continue up the upper arete with challenges of its own. This is really an enjoyable route for the grade if you like aretes.
content.location:
This ascends an arete to the right of

Thinner

.

content.description: Begin from a boulder in the moat, enjoying a nice quartz crystal. Follow the line of bolts until they inexplicably end 20 feet below the anchors. Run it out either straight up, or more easily around the corner to the right, then back left. You can place a medium cam in a horizontal or sling a horn with a shoulder length runner to protect this last bit, although it is relatively easy.
content.protection: 9 bolts and an optional long runner or medium-sized cam.
content.location: Climb a black streaked face on the left end of the ledge.

content.description: On the left side of the ledge, begin under a bulging arete. Quickly pull a small roof past the second bolt, then up a slabby face to a final roof. Pass this on the left to finish a fun route.
content.location: This begins on the left side of the ledge under a bulging arete.

content.description: Just right of the deep chimney leading to GT1 is an appealing face/arete. This latter is the line of GT2. Follow the line of bolts 100 feet to the first set of anchors or 115 feet to the second set. (This is worthwhile if you have a 70 meter rope. A 60 WILL NOT reach from the second anchors to the ground.)
content.protection: 9 bolts to the first anchor, 15 to the upper anchor.
content.location: Start right of a deep chimney.
